column4: Can I install ubuntu to a hard drive that has the install iso on it?
without issue? Or do I have to do something special?
I could just dd the iso to the hard drive - right?
I have  an iso on my computer. The only way to get it to the one I want to install it on is to put it on a hard drive and boot it up. I could then install back to the same HDD
I want to make sure that dd will make the disk bootable
dd has nothing to do with making it bootable
how else to get the iso from my computer to the relevent HDD?
yes, but the iso doesn't have an mbr
I'm used to just "burning" the iso, popping in the disk, and booting. I'm not used to having to get critical parts like the mbr on my own
